creator: Friedrich Schiller
description:
LibriVox recording of The Camp of Wallenstein by Friedrich Schiller. (Translated by James S. Churchill.)
Read in English by Anna Simon; TriciaG; Availle; Algy Pug; Julia Niedermaier; David Olson; Arnaldo Machado; Kristin Gjerløw; ToddHW; alanmapstone; Charlotte Duckett; Libby Gohn; Savannah; bala; Larry Wilson; BeniaminoMassimo; KHand; Peter Tucker; Rosslyn Carlyle

This is the first play of Friedrich Schiller's Wallenstein Trilogy. Set in a Bohemian camp during the Thirty Years War, it introduces the major characters of the rest of the trilogy, like Albrecht von Wallenstein and Max Piccolomini, from their subordinates' point of view. (Summary by Libby Gohn)

For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
subject: librivox; audiobooks;trilogy; bohemia; historical play; ensemble; thirty years war; 30 years war
title: The Camp of Wallenstein
